summary:
Here is my custom settings for Pluto's fantastic mod "Realistic Lighting With Customization".
Those settings are for people who like dark places (dungeons and ruins), using their torches and light spells.
descriptionHtml:
[img] http://static-2.nexusmods.com/15/mods/110/images/9868-1-1329526419.jpg [/img]

[color=#4ea2e5] _______________________________________________________________________________ [/color]

[b] [color=#4ea2e5] Psychosteve's Custom Realistic Lighting [/color][/b] [b] | V 1.1 [/b]
[color=#4ea2e5] _______________________________________________________________________________ [/color]


Here is my custom settings for [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/modules/members/index.php?id=3105456 target="_blank"] Pluto [/url]'s fantastic [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=7654 target="_blank"] Realistic Lighting With Customization [/url] mod.

Those settings are for people who like [b] [color=#ffe292] dark places [/color] [/b] (dungeons and ruins), using their

torches and light spells. Those settings are for the [color=#ffe292] 3.4 [/color] version of the mod. (v3.31 RL compatible

settings are still avaliable).

Enjoy !!




[b] [color=#fbaf37] What's in the box ?? [/color] [/b]
[color=#fbaf37] _______________________________________________________________________________ [/color]

[list]
[*] 1 [color=#ffe292] Realistic Lighting Patcher.esp [/color] file (tweeked with my settings)

[*] 1 [color=#ffe292] RealisticLighting.ini [/color] file (my settings for you to edit if you need)

[*] 1 [color=#ffe292] sharpness [/color] FXAA injector add-on (optional)
[/list]



[b] [color=#fbaf37] Install [/color] [/b]
[color=#fbaf37] _______________________________________________________________________________ [/color]


You will need to install the original [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=7654 target="_blank"] Realistic Lighting With Customization [/url] mod before.

[b] [color=#fbaf37] IMPORTANT :[/color] [/b] [color=#ffe292]Realistic Lighting.esp[/color] [b] [color=#fbaf37] MUST BE LOADED BEFORE [/color] [/b] [color=#ffe292]Realistic Lighting Patcher.esp[/color].

You will have to change the mods' loading order using [color=#ffe292]Nexus Mod Manager[/color] [b] [color=#fbaf37] AND [/color] [/b] in the [color=#ffe292]skyrim

launcher's mod list[/color].




[b] [color=#fbaf37]Main install :[/color] [/b]
[list]
[*] Use [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/content/modmanager/ target="_blank"] Nexus Mod Manager[/url] to install my mod.

[b] [color=#fbaf37]OR[/color] [/b]

[*] Copy my [color=#ffe292]Realistic Lighting Patcher.esp[/color] from the [color=#ffe292]Data[/color] folder

[*] Paste it in your [color=#ffe292]Skyrim/Data[/color] game folder (replace the file if needed)

[*] Put your [color=#ffe292]brightness[/color] option ingame to "0" (full left) for a better experience
[/list]


[b] [color=#fbaf37]Options :[/color] [/b]

you can install those mods to enhace this cutom configuration :


[b] [color=#ffe292]+ FXAA Sharpness profil injector :[/color] [/b]
[list]
[*] install the [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=131 target="_blank"] Post_Process_Injector_1_3 [/url]

[*] choose [color=#ffe292]preset 01[/color] during this install

[*] copy my [color=#ffe292]injFX_Settings.h[/color] file from the [color=#ffe292]Sharpen Effect [optional][/color] folder

[*] paste it into your [color=#ffe292]Skyrim[/color] game root folder

[*] replace the file if needed






[b] [color=#ffe292]+ Torches for Realistic Lighting mod :[/color] [/b]

you can also install the [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=8741 target="_blank"] Torches for Realistic Lighting [/url] mod by [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/modules/members/index.php?id=1575588 target="_blank"] Monophonotronic [/url] to have a
better brightness and radius with your torches.

[b] [color=#ffe292]+ Enhanced lights and FX mod :[/color] [/b]

For a better experience and lighting immersion you can also install [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/27043] Enhanced lights and FX [/url].



[b] [color=#fbaf37] Uninstall [/color] [/b]
[color=#fbaf37] _______________________________________________________________________________ [/color]


[*] Just uninstall the mod with [color=#ffe292] Nexus Mod Manager [/color]

[b] [color=#fbaf37]OR[/color] [/b]

[*] Manually delete the [color=#ffe292]Realistic Lighting Patcher.esp[/color] from your [color=#ffe292] Data[/color] game folder
[/list]



[b][color=#fbaf37]Need help making your own custom effects ?[/color][/b]
[color=#fbaf37] _______________________________________________________________________________ [/color]


Here is a list of different places to go. That will help you tweek the [color=#ffe292] RealisticLighting.ini [/color] file

like you want and find better balanced effects. Those places are really differents from one to

another (colors, lights...) :


[b] [color=#ffe292] Interiors : [/color] [/b]
[list]
[*] Breezhome (whiterun) => warm lights / small room

[*] The Bannered Mare (Whiterun) => warm lights / large room

[*] The Winking Skeever (Solitude) => red ambiant lights
[/list]


[b] [color=#ffe292] Dungeons : [/color] [/b]
[list]
[*] Embershard mine (west of Riverwood) => red / blue ambiant lights

[*] Forelhost Stronghold (south east of the map near Riften) => red / yellow ambiant lights

[*] Silverdrift Lair (north from Whiterun or any nord ruin) => pale yellow ambiant lights

[*] Tolvald's Cave (eastern part of the map...or any falmers' cave) => pale / blue ambiant lights
[/list]


[b] [color=#ffe292] Landscapes (Day / Night / Dawn / Dusk) : [/color] [/b]
[list]
[*] Whiterun

[*] Riverwood

[*] Weynon Stone (north of Whiterun) => brighter ambiant lights (snow)

[*] Solitude (near Katla's Farm or the boats) => best for dawns
[/list]


[b] [color=#ffe292] Nights - you MUST test... : [/color] [/b]
[list]
[*] clear sky nights

[*] clear sky nights with aurora

[*] cloudy nights

[*] cloudy nights with aurora

[*] Storm nights (darker and cloudier)
[/list]


[b] [color=#ffe292] Days - you MUST test... : [/color] [/b]
[list]
[*] on regular grounds

[*] on snowy grounds (refraction of the snow = brighter)
[/list]



[b][color=#fbaf37]Credits[/color][/b]
[color=#fbaf37] _______________________________________________________________________________ [/color]


Thanks to Pluto for the original mod :
[list]
[*] [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=7654 target="_blank"] Realistic Lighting With Customization [/url]
[/list]

Thanks to redguard216 for his help :
[list]
[*] [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=9251 target="_blank"] Redguards Realistic Lighting with Customization Configuratio[/url]
[/list]


[b] [color=#fbaf37] Want more ? [/color] [/b]
[color=#fbaf37] _______________________________________________________________________________ [/color]


Don't forget to check out my other mods :

[list]
[*] [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=4707 target="_blank"] Psychosteve's DragonPriest Masks [/url]

[*] [url=http://www.skyrimnexus.com/downloads/file.php?id=6538 target="_blank"] Psychosteve's Golden God's Shrines [/url]

[*] [url=http://www.skyrimnexus.com/downloads/file.php?id=4640 target="_blank"] Psychosteve's Stone of Barenziah [/url]

[*] [url=http://www.skyrimnexus.com/downloads/file.php?id=5763 target="_blank"] Psychosteve's Bust of the Gray Fox [/url]

[*] [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=11010 target="_blank"] Psychosteve's SkyUI icon Set [/url]

[*] [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=7699 target="_blank"] Psychosteve's Horse Whistle sound [/url]
[/list]
author: Psychosteve
